meanings.definition: A person who calls forth or summons something.
meanings.sent1: The evocator of courage inspired us to face our fears.
meanings.sent2: The evocator of memories brought back happy moments from the past.
meanings.sent3: The evocator of laughter had everyone in stitches with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an evocator of joy, brightening up the room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The evocator of emotions in the movie made the audience cry and laugh at the same time.

meanings.definition: Something that calls forth or summons a response or feeling.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful painting was an evocator of admiration from all who saw it.
meanings.sent2: The haunting melody was an evocator of sadness in everyone who listened.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of baking was an evocator of hunger for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph was an evocator of nostalgia, bringing back memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The evocator of curiosity in the mystery novel kept readers turning the pages eagerly.
